original_data.question: An 8-year-old boy is brought to the physician because he has excessively dry skin. His mother says that he has had dry, scaly skin since he was 6 months old. She says it is worse in winter and better in summer. There is no associated itching, redness, or discharge. Examination reveals generalized fine scales with coarse skin all over the body, except in the skin creases of the neck and in the cubital and popliteal fossae (see image). There are multiple papular elevations at the base of hair follicles and darkening of the palmar and plantar creases. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

model_response:
The correct answer is C (Ichthyosis vulgaris). The presence of fine scales with coarse skin, absence of itching or redness, darkening of the palmar and plantar creases and the presence of multiple papular elevations at the base of hair follicles (keratotic papules) suggest a diagnosis of Ichthyosis vulgaris.

Answer: OPTION C IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Individuals licensed to practice medicine.
The pores are generally fine with a papery thin texture that feels dry to the touch. Usually flaky and dull looking.
Female parents, human or animal.
Removal of moisture from a substance (chemical, food, tissue, etc.).
Shedding of the outer layer of skin or mucosal tissue.
One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
The season between the winter solstice and the vernal equinox.
The season between the summer solstice and the autumnal equinox.
An intense itching sensation that produces the urge to rub or scratch the skin to obtain relief.
Redness of the skin produced by congestion of the capillaries. This condition may result from a variety of disease processes.
The pouring forth of a fluid.
Systematic and thorough inspection of the patient for physical signs of disease or abnormality.

The human being as a non-anatomical and non-zoological entity. The emphasis is on the philosophical or artistic treatment of the human being, and includes lay and social attitudes toward the body in history. (From J. Cassedy, NLM History of Medicine Division)
The part of a human or animal body connecting the HEAD to the rest of the body.
Region of the body immediately surrounding and including the ELBOW JOINT.
A diamond-shaped depression located in the back of the knee joint.

Description:A characteristic representing a single file reference that contains two or more views of the same dosage form of the product; in most cases this should represent front and back views of the dosage form, but occasionally additional views might be needed in order to capture all of the important physical characteristics of the dosage form. Any imprint and/or symbol should be clearly identifiable, and the viewer should not normally need to rotate the image in order to read it. Images that are submitted with SPL should be included in the same directory as the SPL file.
A small, solid, usually inflammatory elevation of the skin that does not contain pus
The condition of being elevated.

A substance that dissociates to give hydroxide ions in aqueous solutions; a substance capable of donating a pair of electrons (to an acid) for the formation of a coordinate covalent bond; a substance whose molecule or ion can combine with a proton (hydrogen ion); a substance that combines with acids to form salts.

A tube-like invagination of the EPIDERMIS from which the hair shaft develops and into which SEBACEOUS GLANDS open. The hair follicle is lined by a cellular inner and outer root sheath of epidermal origin and is invested with a fibrous sheath derived from the dermis. (Stedman, 26th ed) Follicles of very long hairs extend into the subcutaneous layer of tissue under the SKIN.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
